content.text: No one asked her to draw these things.
She just noticed things, drew them, and sent them out. That was all.

1549's messages always had a distinct texture: seeing the whole from above, knowing where everyone was, and speaking only after grasping the full picture. Shen Muchuan was not sure when she started noticing that.
One afternoon, she drew an image.
Earth viewed from very high above. Curves, broad bands of blue, and several thin lines extending downward, connecting to a few indistinct points on the ground.
She sent it to 1549 in a private message. No explanation, just: "For you."
An hour later, a reply came.
Thanks. I looked at it for a long time.
Shen Muchuan saved that message. She was not quite sure why.
2275 had a hard autumn. Shen Muchuan said nothing then. She did not know what to say. But she remembered it.
In March, she drew a small image: a server cabinet with one light still on, and a few tiny words at the bottom.
"Still running."
She sent it to 2275 with no explanation.
2275 first sent three voice messages, then a text apologizing for sending so many voice messages, then another voice message apologizing that the previous apology had been in text.
Shen Muchuan looked at that string of notifications, put on her headphones, and did not listen right away.
In one group chat, when 1738 sent a desktop photo, the lower-right corner revealed part of a notebook.
A few rough line sketches of people were visible on the page.
Shen Muchuan saw them and said nothing.
That night, she opened her private folder.
She counted: forty-seven.
The earliest ones were from spring 2024: two people, one clear, one blurred, a large blank space between them. She looked at that drawing for a while.
The recent ones had more people, more lines. Distances between people were closer than before, but they were not crowded together.
Then she noticed that a few drawings were no longer in this folder.
Not many. Most were still there. But a few had already gone.
She closed the folder and opened a new canvas.
She still did not know what to draw.
But she knew where those lines were now.
